moves.1. e4: The game database identified this as C41: Philidor's defence
moves.1... e5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 f6 4. dxe5 fxe5: at this point i've developed all 4 minor pieces and black's are still all on his back rank....
moves.7... c6: Black wastes another move and takes away the best square from his knight
moves.8. Qd2: i am now prepared to castle long
moves.9. Bxg8: i decide to stop letting black take space with his pawns and this prevents black from castling kingside
moves.9... Rxg8 10. O-O-O: now i have my queen and rook focused on the pawn on d6
moves.11. Bc5: Black cannot play dxc5 without losing his queen
moves.11... d5 12. Bxf8: i take black's better bishop and i will gain a pawn after Rxf8
moves.12... Rxf8 13. Nxe5: i debated exd5 but i know that i can play that move next
moves.13... Qg5: black forces a trade of queens and doubles his paws on the g file
moves.14. Qxg5 hxg5 15. exd5: finally i get a chance to play exd5
moves.15... Bb7: I don't know what black was thinking here.  Rxf2 seemed logical
moves.16. dxc6 Bxc6 17. Nxc6 Nxc6: i'm two pawns up when the dust settles with a strong pawn structure and  two more pawns than my opponent
moves.18. Rd6 Rc8 19. f3 b4 20. Ne4: moves the knight to a square where black's pawns cannot attack it and attacks black's pawn
moves.24... Nxd4 25. Rxd4 Rh8 26. h3: i control both open files and have a 3 pawn advantage
moves.26... Rg5 27. Re2 Rc8 28. b3 g6 29. Rde4: Forcing the exchange of rooks or black losing a pawn
moves.30... Rg3 31. Rxa5 g5 32. Rb5 Ra8 33. Rx: Ra4! black is now forced to trade rooks and resignes because his other rook is trapped and his king cannot cross the E file, so nothing can stop me from getting 2 more queens
